edge: Universal Pictures had been planning a remake of the 1973 film of the same name since the 1990s.
Neil LaBute was writing and directing The Wicker Man for Universal and Nicolas Cage's production company Saturn Films.
Canal+ had the licensing library of The Wicker Man (original) which was optioned by producer JoAnne Sellar to Universal.
Director Robin Hardy was preparing a semi-remake of their 1973 film, titled The Riding of the Laddie.
Christopher Lee was attached to The Wicker Man (semi-remake) as their Lord of the Rings co-star Sean Astin.
Vanessa Redgrave was attached to The Riding of the Laddie, a semi-remake of The Wicker Man (original).
Sean Astin was attached to The Riding of the Laddie, a semi-remake of The Wicker Man (original).
Millennium Films purchased the remake rights for The Wicker Man.
Alcon Entertainment acquired distribution rights for The Wicker Man (remake) through their output deal.
Millennium sold distribution rights to Alcon Entertainment for distribution in Vancouver, Canada in July 2005.
Millennium sold distribution rights to Alcon Entertainment for distribution in Vancouver, Canada in July 2005.
Millennium sold distribution rights to Alcon Entertainment for distribution through their output deal with Warner Bros. Pictures.
